thig5.8:4.4: 'anupādāya' is probably instrumental or ablative - "quenched because of not grasping", or "quenched by means of not grasping"
thig5.8:5.3: Technically there is no word 'body' in this phrase. Without any other context, I might render this phrase as "Damn this contemptible decrepitude!" But I think the intended meaning here is that she's indicating her triumph over birth-aging-death. The word "atthu" means "let it exist" - so perhaps she is saying "Let there be this contemptible decrepitude" - as in, "Why would I care that there is decrepitude since I am awakened?"
